document.docAuthor: Machado, Éwerton O., Laborda, Álvaro, Simó, Miguel & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.docTitle: Mesabolivar charrua Machado, Laborda, Simó & Brescovit, 2013, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Contributions to the taxonomy and distribution of the genus Mesabolivar in southern South America (Araneae: Pholcidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contributions to the taxonomy and distribution of the genus Mesabolivar in southern South America (Araneae: Pholcidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype :
Male holotype from Sierra de Ánimas, Maldonado, Uruguay , (
34 ° 42 ' S
55 ° 19 ' 59 '' W
),
18 .VI. 1950
, L.C. de Zolessi leg., in FCE ( 2361 ).
Paratypes :
female (FCE 2361 ) same data as holotype ;
1 male
and
1 female
( IBSP 161828 ) Gruta del Palacio, Flores , Uruguay , (
33 ° 12 ' S
57 ° 05'W
),
23 .IV. 1995
, A. Olmos leg.;
1 male
and
1 female
(
MCN 19339
), Triunfo ( 29 ° 56 ʹ 34 ʺS, 51 ° 43 ʹ 4 ʺW), Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil ,
25 .I. 1990
, A. D. Brescovit leg.
Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition honoring the main indigenous tribe that inhabited the actual Uruguayan territory in the past.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 15–24.
Mesabolivar charrua
sp. nov.
. 15. Male chelicerae, frontal. 16, Male left palp, retrolateral. 17, Procursus, retrolateral slightly dorsal. 18–19, Procursus tip. dorsal (18), prolateral (19). 20, Bulb, prolateral. Arrows shows the membranous projection. 21, Male palpal femur, retrolateral. 22–24, Epigynum, ventral (22), lateral (23), dorsal (24). Scale: 0.5 mm.

FIGURES 25–30.
Mesabolivar charrua
sp. nov.
, scanning electron micrographs. 25, Male chelicerae, frontal. 26, Tarsal organ, left palp. 27, Left bulb, retrolateral. 28, Bulb opening detail. 29, Left procursus, prolateral. 30, Left procursus, microspinulation detail.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Three males: carapace width 1.3–1.4 ; tibia I: 8.8–9.6 . Three females: carapace width 1.2–1.3 ; tibia I: 6.8–9.8 .

Natural history . This species constructs the webs near the soil in humid sites near water courses and roots of trees.
